subject: Business
title: Disruption from Below
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Disruption from Below.

hook.text: Mini steel mills made cheap, low-quality rebar. Big mills ignored them. Then mini mills ate the whole industry.

buildup.text: Disruption from below starts in the least attractive market segment â€” the one incumbents happily abandon.

discovery.text: The disruptor's product improves over time. What starts as 'not good enough' becomes 'good enough and cheaper.'

twist.text: Incumbents rationally retreat upmarket each time. Every step up feels profitable â€” until there's nowhere left to go.

climax.text: Toyota entered the US with cheap, small cars. Detroit laughed. Toyota is now the world's largest automaker.

punchline.text: If you're ignoring the low end, someone is building your replacement.

quiz.question: Where does disruption from below typically start?
options: In the least attractive market segment incumbents abandon
At the premium end of the market
